comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: (Magnigcenit Fads Bridge) I can see how it could become a Fad to describe this bridge as Magnigcenit. ;) The magnificent Eads Bridge was named for the novice bridge designer and builder, James B. Eads (1820-1887). [1] What excellent typos! ;)

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: What would we do without you!

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: = What would we do ... I dunno ...   the Fads name seems to hang on regardless.

comment._content: And now you can take this magnificent bridge right into the heart of the ghetto...

comment.author: 29892538@N05
comment._content: I may sound like a "Kook", but truth is, my great grandfather build the bridge.  He was a Jordan, and his wife's family name was Edes.   He and his wife were originally from Arkansas.  After he built this bridge, he returned to Arkansas where he lived the rest of his life.
